intro: Silene chromodonta, commonly known as the redstem sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Silene chromodonta is also known for its ability to bloom in early spring, making it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
